comments.body: Can you include the `license_file`, please? It is required for Apache 2

Ok, license file is not in the source archive, but in the repo.

I'll run into the same issue as [git-lfs recipe](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/2015).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@about:
  home: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ninja_syntax/1.6.0
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/COPYING'  # From https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja
  summary: 'Python module for generating .ninja files.'

@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@build:
  number: 0
  script: python setup.py install

requirements:

comments.body: Looks like the homepage is https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja . If so, is this a dup of [`ninja`]( https://github.com/conda-forge/ninja-feedstock ), which we already have?

The [ninja_syntax package on pypi](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ninja_syntax/1.6.0) provides just one file, https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja/blob/master/misc/ninja_syntax.py .

So it's a package for on file of https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja. This file will be duplicated in packages `ninja` and `ninja_syntax`.

`ninja_syntax` allows python modules to generate .ninja files, without installing the entire `ninja` (which imply compiling C++).

For a conda point of view, one package would be enough, but software such as [craftr](https://github.com/craftr-build/craftr) do [import](https://github.com/craftr-build/craftr/blob/cc94a5440eb3d7b31ab8e5f516a74880f040a309/craftr/core/build.py#L32) `ninja_syntax`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@
about:
  home: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ninja_syntax/1.6.0
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/COPYING'  # From https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja
